attributes.name: Circulatory System
attributes.description: The system that circulates blood throughout the body, delivering oxygen and nutrients to cells and removing waste products.

attributes.name: Respiratory System
attributes.description: The system responsible for gas exchange, taking in oxygen and expelling carbon dioxide.

attributes.name: Nervous System
attributes.description: The complex network that coordinates body activities by transmitting signals between different body parts.

attributes.name: Skeletal System
attributes.description: The framework of bones and connective tissues that supports the body, protects organs, and enables movement.

attributes.name: Muscular System
attributes.description: The system of muscles that enables movement, maintains posture, and generates heat.

attributes.name: Digestive System
attributes.description: The system that breaks down food into nutrients for absorption and eliminates waste.
attributes.length: About 9 meters (30 feet) from mouth to anus

attributes.name: Endocrine System
attributes.description: The collection of glands that produce hormones to regulate metabolism, growth, development, and other functions.

attributes.name: Immune System
attributes.description: The complex network that defends the body against pathogens and other threats.

attributes.name: Heart
attributes.description: A muscular organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system by rhythmic contraction and dilation.

attributes.name: Lungs
attributes.description: The primary organs of respiration, where gas exchange occurs between the air and blood.

attributes.name: Brain
attributes.description: The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing sensory information and controlling bodily functions and behaviors.

attributes.name: Liver
attributes.description: The largest internal organ, performing hundreds of functions including detoxification, protein synthesis, and digestion.

attributes.name: Kidneys
attributes.description: Bean-shaped organs that filter blood to produce urine, regulate electrolytes, and maintain acid-base balance.

attributes.name: Stomach
attributes.description: A muscular, hollow organ that holds food and begins the digestion of proteins.

attributes.name: Intestines
attributes.description: The long, coiled tube where most digestion and nutrient absorption occurs.

attributes.name: Pancreas
attributes.description: A glandular organ that secretes digestive enzymes and hormones like insulin and glucagon.

attributes.name: Spleen
attributes.description: An organ that filters blood and helps defend against pathogens as part of the immune system.

attributes.name: Skull
attributes.description: The bony structure that forms the head, encases the brain, and supports facial structures.

attributes.name: Vertebral Column (Spine)
attributes.description: The flexible column of vertebrae that protects the spinal cord and supports the head and body.

attributes.name: Ribcage
attributes.description: The bony cage formed by the sternum, ribs, and thoracic vertebrae that protects vital organs.

attributes.name: Femur
attributes.description: The thigh bone, the longest and strongest bone in the human body.

attributes.name: Cardiac Muscle
attributes.description: Specialized involuntary muscle tissue found only in the heart, allowing for coordinated contractions.

attributes.name: Diaphragm
attributes.description: A dome-shaped skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic and abdominal cavities and is essential for breathing.

attributes.name: Biceps Brachii
attributes.description: A large muscle located on the front of the upper arm, primarily responsible for forearm flexion and supination.
attributes.location: Anterior compartment of the upper arm

attributes.name: Quadriceps Femoris
attributes.description: A group of four muscles on the front of the thigh that extend the knee.

attributes.name: Aorta
attributes.description: The largest artery in the body, carrying oxygenated blood from the left ventricle of the heart to the body.
attributes.function: Distribution of oxygenated blood throughout the body

attributes.name: Coronary Arteries
attributes.description: The arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle.

attributes.name: Pulmonary Arteries
attributes.description: The arteries that carry deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs.
attributes.uniqueProperty: One of the few arteries carrying deoxygenated blood
attributes.function: Transport of deoxygenated blood to lungs for oxygenation

attributes.name: Vena Cava
attributes.description: The largest veins in the body, returning deoxygenated blood to the right atrium of the heart.
attributes.function: Return of deoxygenated blood to the heart

attributes.name: Spinal Cord
attributes.description: The cylindrical bundle of nerve fibers that extends from the brain and is protected by the vertebral column.
attributes.function: Conduction of neural signals between brain and body, reflex center

attributes.name: Vagus Nerve
attributes.description: The 10th cranial nerve, with the widest distribution in the body, controlling parasympathetic functions.
attributes.function: Parasympathetic control of heart, lungs, digestive tract; sensory information from viscera

attributes.name: Sciatic Nerve
attributes.description: The largest and longest nerve in the body, running from the lower back down through the leg.
attributes.function: Motor and sensory innervation of lower limb

attributes.name: Hypothalamus
attributes.description: A small region of the brain that coordinates both the autonomic nervous system and the endocrine system.

attributes.name: Neuron
attributes.description: The basic functional unit of the nervous system, specialized for transmitting information.
attributes.count: Approximately 86 billion in the human brain

attributes.name: Red Blood Cell (Erythrocyte)
attributes.description: The most common type of blood cell, responsible for oxygen transport.

attributes.name: Cardiomyocyte
attributes.description: Cardiac muscle cells that make up the heart muscle.

attributes.name: Epithelial Tissue
attributes.description: The tissue that forms the outer layer of the body and lines organs and cavities.
attributes.location: Skin surface, organ linings, gland secretory units

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<graphml xmlns="http://graphml.graphdrawing.org/xmlns"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://graphml.graphdrawing.org/xmlns
         http://graphml.graphdrawing.org/xmlns/1.0/graphml.xsd">
  <graph id="G" edgedefault="directed">
    <!-- Node attribute keys -->
    <key id="type" for="node" attr.name="type" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="name" for="node" attr.name="name" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="description" for="node" attr.name="description" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="functions" for="node" attr.name="functions" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="volume" for="node" attr.name="volume" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="capacity" for="node" attr.name="capacity" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="components" for="node" attr.name="components" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="neurons" for="node" attr.name="neurons" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="boneCount" for="node" attr.name="boneCount" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="muscleCount" for="node" attr.name="muscleCount" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="types" for="node" attr.name="types" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="length" for="node" attr.name="length" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="majorGlands" for="node" attr.name="majorGlands" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="weight" for="node" attr.name="weight" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="location" for="node" attr.name="location" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="chambers" for="node" attr.name="chambers" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="beatRate" for="node" attr.name="beatRate" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="count" for="node" attr.name="count" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="parts" for="node" attr.name="parts" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="respirationRate" for="node" attr.name="respirationRate" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="lobes" for="node" attr.name="lobes" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="energyUse" for="node" attr.name="energyUse" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="filterRate" for="node" attr.name="filterRate" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="pH" for="node" attr.name="pH" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="regions" for="node" attr.name="regions" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="smallIntestineLength" for="node" attr.name="smallIntestineLength" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="largeIntestineLength" for="node" attr.name="largeIntestineLength" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="majorBones" for="node" attr.name="majorBones" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="vertebraeCount" for="node" attr.name="vertebraeCount" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="ribPairs" for="node" attr.name="ribPairs" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="strength" for="node" attr.name="strength" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="control" for="node" attr.name="control" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="properties" for="node" attr.name="properties" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="function" for="node" attr.name="function" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="diameter" for="node" attr.name="diameter" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="sections" for="node" attr.name="sections" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="majorBranches" for="node" attr.name="majorBranches" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="branches" for="node" attr.name="branches" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="uniqueProperty" for="node" attr.name="uniqueProperty" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="number" for="node" attr.name="number" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="origin" for="node" attr.name="origin" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="shape" for="node" attr.name="shape" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="lifespan" for="node" attr.name="lifespan" attr.type="string"/>
    <key id="width" for="node" attr.name="width" attr.type="string"/>
    <!-- Edge attribute keys -->
    <key id="relationship_type" for="edge" attr.name="type" attr.type="string"/>
    <node id="circulatory_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Circulatory System</data>
      <data key="description">The system that circulates blood throughout the body, delivering oxygen and nutrients to cells and removing waste products.</data>
      <data key="functions">Oxygen transport,Nutrient delivery,Waste removal,Hormone transport,Temperature regulation,Immune defense</data>
      <data key="volume">5 liters of blood (average adult)</data>
    </node>
    <node id="respiratory_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Respiratory System</data>
      <data key="description">The system responsible for gas exchange, taking in oxygen and expelling carbon dioxide.</data>
      <data key="functions">Gas exchange,pH regulation,Voice production,Olfaction support</data>
      <data key="capacity">4-6 liters (average adult lung capacity)</data>
    </node>
    <node id="nervous_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Nervous System</data>
      <data key="description">The complex network that coordinates body activities by transmitting signals between different body parts.</data>
      <data key="functions">Sensory processing,Motor control,Cognition,Memory,Homeostasis regulation</data>
      <data key="components">Central nervous system,Peripheral nervous system,Autonomic nervous system</data>
      <data key="neurons">Approximately 86 billion neurons</data>
    </node>
    <node id="skeletal_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Skeletal System</data>
      <data key="description">The framework of bones and connective tissues that supports the body, protects organs, and enables movement.</data>
      <data key="functions">Structural support,Organ protection,Movement facilitation,Blood cell production,Mineral storage</data>
      <data key="boneCount">206</data>
    </node>
    <node id="muscular_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Muscular System</data>
      <data key="description">The system of muscles that enables movement, maintains posture, and generates heat.</data>
      <data key="functions">Movement,Posture maintenance,Joint stabilization,Heat production</data>
      <data key="muscleCount">Over 600 named muscles</data>
      <data key="types">Skeletal muscle,Smooth muscle,Cardiac muscle</data>
    </node>
    <node id="digestive_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Digestive System</data>
      <data key="description">The system that breaks down food into nutrients for absorption and eliminates waste.</data>
      <data key="functions">Food breakdown,Nutrient absorption,Waste elimination</data>
      <data key="length">About 9 meters (30 feet) from mouth to anus</data>
    </node>
    <node id="endocrine_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Endocrine System</data>
      <data key="description">The collection of glands that produce hormones to regulate metabolism, growth, development, and other functions.</data>
      <data key="functions">Hormone production,Metabolism regulation,Growth and development,Mood regulation</data>
      <data key="majorGlands">Pituitary,Thyroid,Parathyroid,Adrenal,Pancreas,Gonads,Pineal</data>
    </node>
    <node id="immune_system">
      <data key="type">system</data>
      <data key="name">Immune System</data>
      <data key="description">The complex network that defends the body against pathogens and other threats.</data>
      <data key="functions">Pathogen defense,Wound healing,Foreign substance detection,Cancer surveillance</data>
      <data key="components">White blood cells,Antibodies,Lymphatic system,Spleen,Thymus,Bone marrow</data>
    </node>
    <node id="heart">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Heart</data>
      <data key="description">A muscular organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system by rhythmic contraction and dilation.</data>
      <data key="weight">250-350 grams</data>
      <data key="location">Mediastinum, left of midline</data>
      <data key="chambers">Right atrium,Right ventricle,Left atrium,Left ventricle</data>
      <data key="beatRate">60-100 beats per minute (at rest)</data>
    </node>
    <node id="lungs">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Lungs</data>
      <data key="description">The primary organs of respiration, where gas exchange occurs between the air and blood.</data>
      <data key="count">2</data>
      <data key="location">Thoracic cavity</data>
      <data key="parts">Bronchi,Bronchioles,Alveoli,Pleura</data>
      <data key="respirationRate">12-20 breaths per minute (at rest)</data>
    </node>
    <node id="brain">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Brain</data>
      <data key="description">The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing sensory information and controlling bodily functions and behaviors.</data>
      <data key="weight">1300-1400 grams (average adult)</data>
      <data key="location">Cranial cavity</data>
      <data key="lobes">Frontal,Parietal,Temporal,Occipital</data>
      <data key="energyUse">20% of body's oxygen and calories</data>
    </node>
    <node id="liver">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Liver</data>
      <data key="description">The largest internal organ, performing hundreds of functions including detoxification, protein synthesis, and digestion.</data>
      <data key="weight">1.5 kg (average adult)</data>
      <data key="location">Right upper quadrant of abdomen</data>
      <data key="lobes">Right lobe,Left lobe,Caudate lobe,Quadrate lobe</data>
      <data key="functions">Detoxification,Bile production,Protein synthesis,Glycogen storage</data>
    </node>
    <node id="kidneys">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Kidneys</data>
      <data key="description">Bean-shaped organs that filter blood to produce urine, regulate electrolytes, and maintain acid-base balance.</data>
      <data key="count">2</data>
      <data key="location">Posterior abdominal wall, retroperitoneal</data>
      <data key="weight">120-170 grams each</data>
      <data key="filterRate">About 120-150 quarts of blood daily</data>
    </node>
    <node id="stomach">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Stomach</data>
      <data key="description">A muscular, hollow organ that holds food and begins the digestion of proteins.</data>
      <data key="location">Left upper quadrant of abdomen</data>
      <data key="capacity">1-2 liters</data>
      <data key="pH">1.5-3.5 (highly acidic)</data>
      <data key="regions">Cardia,Fundus,Body,Pylorus</data>
    </node>
    <node id="intestines">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Intestines</data>
      <data key="description">The long, coiled tube where most digestion and nutrient absorption occurs.</data>
      <data key="parts">Small intestine,Large intestine</data>
      <data key="smallIntestineLength">6-7 meters</data>
      <data key="largeIntestineLength">1.5 meters</data>
      <data key="location">Abdominal cavity</data>
    </node>
    <node id="pancreas">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Pancreas</data>
      <data key="description">A glandular organ that secretes digestive enzymes and hormones like insulin and glucagon.</data>
      <data key="location">Retroperitoneal, behind stomach</data>
      <data key="weight">70-100 grams</data>
      <data key="functions">Digestive enzyme production,Hormone secretion,Blood glucose regulation</data>
    </node>
    <node id="spleen">
      <data key="type">organ</data>
      <data key="name">Spleen</data>
      <data key="description">An organ that filters blood and helps defend against pathogens as part of the immune system.</data>
      <data key="location">Left upper quadrant of abdomen</data>
      <data key="weight">150 grams (average adult)</data>
      <data key="functions">Blood filtration,Old red blood cell removal,Immune response support,Blood storage</data>
    </node>
    <node id="skull">
      <data key="type">bone</data>
      <data key="name">Skull</data>
      <data key="description">The bony structure that forms the head, encases the brain, and supports facial structures.</data>
      <data key="boneCount">22</data>
      <data key="majorBones">Frontal bone,Parietal bones,Temporal bones,Occipital bone,Sphenoid bone,Ethmoid bone</data>
      <data key="functions">Brain protection,Facial structure support,Sensory organ housing</data>
    </node>
    <node id="vertebral_column">
      <data key="type">bone</data>
      <data key="name">Vertebral Column (Spine)</data>
      <data key="description">The flexible column of vertebrae that protects the spinal cord and supports the head and body.</data>
      <data key="vertebraeCount">33</data>
      <data key="regions">Cervical (7),Thoracic (12),Lumbar (5),Sacral (5 fused),Coccygeal (4 fused)</data>
      <data key="length">70-75 cm (adult)</data>
    </node>
    <node id="ribcage">
      <data key="type">bone</data>
      <data key="name">Ribcage</data>
      <data key="description">The bony cage formed by the sternum, ribs, and thoracic vertebrae that protects vital organs.</data>
      <data key="ribPairs">12</data>
      <data key="types">True ribs (1-7),False ribs (8-10),Floating ribs (11-12)</data>
      <data key="functions">Heart and lung protection,Respiratory movement support</data>
    </node>
    <node id="femur">
      <data key="type">bone</data>
      <data key="name">Femur</data>
      <data key="description">The thigh bone, the longest and strongest bone in the human body.</data>
      <data key="count">2</data>
      <data key="location">Thigh</data>
      <data key="length">45-50 cm (adult)</data>
      <data key="strength">Can support 30 times body weight</data>
    </node>
    <node id="heart_muscle">
      <data key="type">muscle</data>
      <data key="name">Cardiac Muscle</data>
      <data key="description">Specialized involuntary muscle tissue found only in the heart, allowing for coordinated contractions.</data>
      <data key="control">Involuntary</data>
      <data key="properties">Striated,Self-excitable,Resistant to fatigue,Interconnected by intercalated discs</data>
      <data key="function">Blood pumping through rhythmic contractions</data>
    </node>
    <node id="diaphragm">
      <data key="type">muscle</data>
      <data key="name">Diaphragm</data>
      <data key="description">A dome-shaped skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic and abdominal cavities and is essential for breathing.</data>
      <data key="control">Both voluntary and involuntary</data>
      <data key="location">Between thoracic and abdominal cavities</data>
      <data key="function">Primary muscle of respiration</data>
    </node>
    <node id="biceps_brachii">
      <data key="type">muscle</data>
      <data key="name">Biceps Brachii</data>
      <data key="description">A large muscle located on the front of the upper arm, primarily responsible for forearm flexion and supination.</data>
      <data key="control">Voluntary</data>
      <data key="location">Anterior compartment of the upper arm</data>
      <data key="function">Forearm flexion and supination</data>
    </node>
    <node id="quadriceps">
      <data key="type">muscle</data>
      <data key="name">Quadriceps Femoris</data>
      <data key="description">A group of four muscles on the front of the thigh that extend the knee.</data>
      <data key="control">Voluntary</data>
      <data key="location">Anterior thigh</data>
      <data key="components">Rectus femoris,Vastus lateralis,Vastus medialis,Vastus intermedius</data>
      <data key="function">Knee extension and hip flexion</data>
    </node>
    <node id="aorta">
      <data key="type">blood_vessel</data>
      <data key="name">Aorta</data>
      <data key="description">The largest artery in the body, carrying oxygenated blood from the left ventricle of the heart to the body.</data>
      <data key="diameter">2.5-3.5 cm</data>
      <data key="sections">Ascending aorta,Aortic arch,Descending thoracic aorta,Abdominal aorta</data>
      <data key="function">Distribution of oxygenated blood throughout the body</data>
    </node>
    <node id="coronary_arteries">
      <data key="type">blood_vessel</data>
      <data key="name">Coronary Arteries</data>
      <data key="description">The arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle.</data>
      <data key="majorBranches">Left main coronary artery,Left anterior descending artery,Left circumflex artery,Right coronary artery</data>
      <data key="function">Blood supply to cardiac muscle</data>
    </node>
    <node id="pulmonary_arteries">
      <data key="type">blood_vessel</data>
      <data key="name">Pulmonary Arteries</data>
      <data key="description">The arteries that carry deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs.</data>
      <data key="branches">Right pulmonary artery,Left pulmonary artery</data>
      <data key="uniqueProperty">One of the few arteries carrying deoxygenated blood</data>
      <data key="function">Transport of deoxygenated blood to lungs for oxygenation</data>
    </node>
    <node id="vena_cava">
      <data key="type">blood_vessel</data>
      <data key="name">Vena Cava</data>
      <data key="description">The largest veins in the body, returning deoxygenated blood to the right atrium of the heart.</data>
      <data key="components">Superior vena cava,Inferior vena cava</data>
      <data key="diameter">2-3 cm</data>
      <data key="function">Return of deoxygenated blood to the heart</data>
    </node>
    <node id="spinal_cord">
      <data key="type">nerve</data>
      <data key="name">Spinal Cord</data>
      <data key="description">The cylindrical bundle of nerve fibers that extends from the brain and is protected by the vertebral column.</data>
      <data key="length">45 cm (average adult)</data>
      <data key="location">Within the vertebral canal</data>
      <data key="function">Conduction of neural signals between brain and body, reflex center</data>
      <data key="components">Grey matter,White matter,Central canal</data>
    </node>
    <node id="vagus_nerve">
      <data key="type">nerve</data>
      <data key="name">Vagus Nerve</data>
      <data key="description">The 10th cranial nerve, with the widest distribution in the body, controlling parasympathetic functions.</data>
      <data key="number">CN X</data>
      <data key="function">Parasympathetic control of heart, lungs, digestive tract; sensory information from viscera</data>
      <data key="length">Extends from brainstem to abdomen</data>
    </node>
    <node id="sciatic_nerve">
      <data key="type">nerve</data>
      <data key="name">Sciatic Nerve</data>
      <data key="description">The largest and longest nerve in the body, running from the lower back down through the leg.</data>
      <data key="origin">L4-S3 spinal nerves</data>
      <data key="function">Motor and sensory innervation of lower limb</data>
      <data key="diameter">About 2 cm at its widest</data>
    </node>
    <node id="hypothalamus">
      <data key="type">nerve_center</data>
      <data key="name">Hypothalamus</data>
      <data key="description">A small region of the brain that coordinates both the autonomic nervous system and the endocrine system.</data>
      <data key="location">Below thalamus, above brainstem</data>
      <data key="weight">About 4 grams</data>
      <data key="functions">Temperature regulation,Hunger and thirst control,Sleep-wake cycles,Hormone production,Autonomic function regulation</data>
    </node>
    <node id="neuron">
      <data key="type">cell</data>
      <data key="name">Neuron</data>
      <data key="description">The basic functional unit of the nervous system, specialized for transmitting information.</data>
      <data key="components">Cell body,Dendrites,Axon,Synaptic terminals</data>
      <data key="types">Motor neurons,Sensory neurons,Interneurons</data>
      <data key="function">Signal transmission and processing</data>
      <data key="count">Approximately 86 billion in the human brain</data>
    </node>
    <node id="red_blood_cell">
      <data key="type">cell</data>
      <data key="name">Red Blood Cell (Erythrocyte)</data>
      <data key="description">The most common type of blood cell, responsible for oxygen transport.</data>
      <data key="shape">Biconcave disc</data>
      <data key="diameter">7-8 micrometers</data>
      <data key="lifespan">120 days</data>
      <data key="count">4.5-5.5 million per microliter of blood</data>
      <data key="uniqueProperty">No nucleus in mature form</data>
      <data key="function">Oxygen and carbon dioxide transport</data>
    </node>
    <node id="cardiomyocyte">
      <data key="type">cell</data>
      <data key="name">Cardiomyocyte</data>
      <data key="description">Cardiac muscle cells that make up the heart muscle.</data>
      <data key="length">100 micrometers</data>
      <data key="width">10-25 micrometers</data>
      <data key="properties">Striated,Contains many mitochondria,Connected by intercalated discs</data>
      <data key="function">Heart contraction</data>
      <data key="uniqueProperty">Can contract without neural stimulation</data>
    </node>
    <node id="epithelial_tissue">
      <data key="type">tissue</data>

;; UltraLink Knowledge Interchange Format (KIF) Export
;; Generated: 2025-03-09T03:03:43.852Z

;; Meta-knowledge
(= (creationDate UltraLinkExport) "2025-03-09T03:03:43.852Z")
(= (entityCount UltraLinkExport) 37)
(= (relationshipCount UltraLinkExport) 28)

;; Functions
(deffunction relationshipCount (?x) (length ?kb.relationships))

;; Rules
(defrule entity-attributes-rule
    "A rule to infer additional attributes for entities based on their type"
    (instance ?entity ?type)
    =>
    (if (eq ?type Person)
        then (assert (isAgent ?entity true))))

(forall (?x ?y)
    (=> (and (adapts_to ?x ?y) (> (efficiency-adapts_to ?x ?y) 0.8))
        (well-adapted ?x ?y)))

;; Entities and their attributes
(instance circulatory_system System)
(name circulatory_system "Circulatory System")
(description circulatory_system "The system that circulates blood throughout the body, delivering oxygen and nutrients to cells and removing waste products.")
(functions circulatory_system "[\"Oxygen transport\",\"Nutrient delivery\",\"Waste removal\",\"Hormone transport\",\"Temperature regulation\",\"Immune defense\"]")
(volume circulatory_system "5 liters of blood (average adult)")

(instance respiratory_system System)
(name respiratory_system "Respiratory System")
(description respiratory_system "The system responsible for gas exchange, taking in oxygen and expelling carbon dioxide.")
(functions respiratory_system "[\"Gas exchange\",\"pH regulation\",\"Voice production\",\"Olfaction support\"]")
(capacity respiratory_system "4-6 liters (average adult lung capacity)")

(instance nervous_system System)
(name nervous_system "Nervous System")
(description nervous_system "The complex network that coordinates body activities by transmitting signals between different body parts.")
(functions nervous_system "[\"Sensory processing\",\"Motor control\",\"Cognition\",\"Memory\",\"Homeostasis regulation\"]")
(components nervous_system "[\"Central nervous system\",\"Peripheral nervous system\",\"Autonomic nervous system\"]")
(neurons nervous_system "Approximately 86 billion neurons")

(instance skeletal_system System)
(name skeletal_system "Skeletal System")
(description skeletal_system "The framework of bones and connective tissues that supports the body, protects organs, and enables movement.")
(functions skeletal_system "[\"Structural support\",\"Organ protection\",\"Movement facilitation\",\"Blood cell production\",\"Mineral storage\"]")
(boneCount skeletal_system 206)

(instance muscular_system System)
(name muscular_system "Muscular System")
(description muscular_system "The system of muscles that enables movement, maintains posture, and generates heat.")
(functions muscular_system "[\"Movement\",\"Posture maintenance\",\"Joint stabilization\",\"Heat production\"]")
(muscleCount muscular_system "Over 600 named muscles")
(types muscular_system "[\"Skeletal muscle\",\"Smooth muscle\",\"Cardiac muscle\"]")

(instance digestive_system System)
(name digestive_system "Digestive System")
(description digestive_system "The system that breaks down food into nutrients for absorption and eliminates waste.")
(functions digestive_system "[\"Food breakdown\",\"Nutrient absorption\",\"Waste elimination\"]")
(length digestive_system "About 9 meters (30 feet) from mouth to anus")

(instance endocrine_system System)
(name endocrine_system "Endocrine System")
(description endocrine_system "The collection of glands that produce hormones to regulate metabolism, growth, development, and other functions.")
(functions endocrine_system "[\"Hormone production\",\"Metabolism regulation\",\"Growth and development\",\"Mood regulation\"]")
(majorGlands endocrine_system "[\"Pituitary\",\"Thyroid\",\"Parathyroid\",\"Adrenal\",\"Pancreas\",\"Gonads\",\"Pineal\"]")

(instance immune_system System)
(name immune_system "Immune System")
(description immune_system "The complex network that defends the body against pathogens and other threats.")
(functions immune_system "[\"Pathogen defense\",\"Wound healing\",\"Foreign substance detection\",\"Cancer surveillance\"]")
(components immune_system "[\"White blood cells\",\"Antibodies\",\"Lymphatic system\",\"Spleen\",\"Thymus\",\"Bone marrow\"]")

(instance heart Organ)
(name heart "Heart")
(description heart "A muscular organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system by rhythmic contraction and dilation.")
(weight heart "250-350 grams")
(location heart "Mediastinum, left of midline")
(chambers heart "[\"Right atrium\",\"Right ventricle\",\"Left atrium\",\"Left ventricle\"]")
(beatRate heart "60-100 beats per minute (at rest)")

(instance lungs Organ)
(name lungs "Lungs")
(description lungs "The primary organs of respiration, where gas exchange occurs between the air and blood.")
(count lungs 2)
(location lungs "Thoracic cavity")
(parts lungs "[\"Bronchi\",\"Bronchioles\",\"Alveoli\",\"Pleura\"]")
(respirationRate lungs "12-20 breaths per minute (at rest)")

(instance brain Organ)
(name brain "Brain")
(description brain "The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing sensory information and controlling bodily functions and behaviors.")
(weight brain "1300-1400 grams (average adult)")
(location brain "Cranial cavity")
(lobes brain "[\"Frontal\",\"Parietal\",\"Temporal\",\"Occipital\"]")
(energyUse brain "20% of body's oxygen and calories")

(instance liver Organ)
(name liver "Liver")
(description liver "The largest internal organ, performing hundreds of functions including detoxification, protein synthesis, and digestion.")
(weight liver "1.5 kg (average adult)")
(location liver "Right upper quadrant of abdomen")
(lobes liver "[\"Right lobe\",\"Left lobe\",\"Caudate lobe\",\"Quadrate lobe\"]")
(functions liver "[\"Detoxification\",\"Bile production\",\"Protein synthesis\",\"Glycogen storage\"]")

(instance kidneys Organ)
(name kidneys "Kidneys")
(description kidneys "Bean-shaped organs that filter blood to produce urine, regulate electrolytes, and maintain acid-base balance.")
(count kidneys 2)
(location kidneys "Posterior abdominal wall, retroperitoneal")
(weight kidneys "120-170 grams each")
(filterRate kidneys "About 120-150 quarts of blood daily")

(instance stomach Organ)
(name stomach "Stomach")
(description stomach "A muscular, hollow organ that holds food and begins the digestion of proteins.")
(location stomach "Left upper quadrant of abdomen")
(capacity stomach "1-2 liters")
(pH stomach "1.5-3.5 (highly acidic)")
(regions stomach "[\"Cardia\",\"Fundus\",\"Body\",\"Pylorus\"]")

(instance intestines Organ)
(name intestines "Intestines")
(description intestines "The long, coiled tube where most digestion and nutrient absorption occurs.")
(parts intestines "[\"Small intestine\",\"Large intestine\"]")
(smallIntestineLength intestines "6-7 meters")
(largeIntestineLength intestines "1.5 meters")
(location intestines "Abdominal cavity")

(instance pancreas Organ)
(name pancreas "Pancreas")
(description pancreas "A glandular organ that secretes digestive enzymes and hormones like insulin and glucagon.")
(location pancreas "Retroperitoneal, behind stomach")
(weight pancreas "70-100 grams")
(functions pancreas "[\"Digestive enzyme production\",\"Hormone secretion\",\"Blood glucose regulation\"]")

(instance spleen Organ)
(name spleen "Spleen")
(description spleen "An organ that filters blood and helps defend against pathogens as part of the immune system.")
(location spleen "Left upper quadrant of abdomen")
(weight spleen "150 grams (average adult)")
(functions spleen "[\"Blood filtration\",\"Old red blood cell removal\",\"Immune response support\",\"Blood storage\"]")

(instance skull Bone)
(name skull "Skull")
(description skull "The bony structure that forms the head, encases the brain, and supports facial structures.")
(boneCount skull 22)
(majorBones skull "[\"Frontal bone\",\"Parietal bones\",\"Temporal bones\",\"Occipital bone\",\"Sphenoid bone\",\"Ethmoid bone\"]")
(functions skull "[\"Brain protection\",\"Facial structure support\",\"Sensory organ housing\"]")

(instance vertebral_column Bone)
(name vertebral_column "Vertebral Column (Spine)")
(description vertebral_column "The flexible column of vertebrae that protects the spinal cord and supports the head and body.")
(vertebraeCount vertebral_column 33)
(regions vertebral_column "[\"Cervical (7)\",\"Thoracic (12)\",\"Lumbar (5)\",\"Sacral (5 fused)\",\"Coccygeal (4 fused)\"]")
(length vertebral_column "70-75 cm (adult)")

(instance ribcage Bone)
(name ribcage "Ribcage")
(description ribcage "The bony cage formed by the sternum, ribs, and thoracic vertebrae that protects vital organs.")
(ribPairs ribcage 12)
(types ribcage "[\"True ribs (1-7)\",\"False ribs (8-10)\",\"Floating ribs (11-12)\"]")
(functions ribcage "[\"Heart and lung protection\",\"Respiratory movement support\"]")

(instance femur Bone)
(name femur "Femur")
(description femur "The thigh bone, the longest and strongest bone in the human body.")
(count femur 2)
(location femur "Thigh")
(length femur "45-50 cm (adult)")
(strength femur "Can support 30 times body weight")

(instance heart_muscle Muscle)
(name heart_muscle "Cardiac Muscle")
(description heart_muscle "Specialized involuntary muscle tissue found only in the heart, allowing for coordinated contractions.")
(control heart_muscle "Involuntary")
(properties heart_muscle "[\"Striated\",\"Self-excitable\",\"Resistant to fatigue\",\"Interconnected by intercalated discs\"]")
(function heart_muscle "Blood pumping through rhythmic contractions")

(instance diaphragm Muscle)
(name diaphragm "Diaphragm")
(description diaphragm "A dome-shaped skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic and abdominal cavities and is essential for breathing.")
(control diaphragm "Both voluntary and involuntary")
(location diaphragm "Between thoracic and abdominal cavities")
(function diaphragm "Primary muscle of respiration")

(instance biceps_brachii Muscle)
(name biceps_brachii "Biceps Brachii")
(description biceps_brachii "A large muscle located on the front of the upper arm, primarily responsible for forearm flexion and supination.")
(control biceps_brachii "Voluntary")
(location biceps_brachii "Anterior compartment of the upper arm")
(function biceps_brachii "Forearm flexion and supination")

(instance quadriceps Muscle)
(name quadriceps "Quadriceps Femoris")
(description quadriceps "A group of four muscles on the front of the thigh that extend the knee.")
(control quadriceps "Voluntary")
(location quadriceps "Anterior thigh")
(components quadriceps "[\"Rectus femoris\",\"Vastus lateralis\",\"Vastus medialis\",\"Vastus intermedius\"]")
(function quadriceps "Knee extension and hip flexion")

(instance aorta Blood_vessel)
(name aorta "Aorta")
(description aorta "The largest artery in the body, carrying oxygenated blood from the left ventricle of the heart to the body.")
(diameter aorta "2.5-3.5 cm")
(sections aorta "[\"Ascending aorta\",\"Aortic arch\",\"Descending thoracic aorta\",\"Abdominal aorta\"]")
(function aorta "Distribution of oxygenated blood throughout the body")

(instance coronary_arteries Blood_vessel)
(name coronary_arteries "Coronary Arteries")
(description coronary_arteries "The arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle.")
(majorBranches coronary_arteries "[\"Left main coronary artery\",\"Left anterior descending artery\",\"Left circumflex artery\",\"Right coronary artery\"]")
(function coronary_arteries "Blood supply to cardiac muscle")

(instance pulmonary_arteries Blood_vessel)
(name pulmonary_arteries "Pulmonary Arteries")
(description pulmonary_arteries "The arteries that carry deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs.")
(branches pulmonary_arteries "[\"Right pulmonary artery\",\"Left pulmonary artery\"]")
(uniqueProperty pulmonary_arteries "One of the few arteries carrying deoxygenated blood")
(function pulmonary_arteries "Transport of deoxygenated blood to lungs for oxygenation")

(instance vena_cava Blood_vessel)
(name vena_cava "Vena Cava")
(description vena_cava "The largest veins in the body, returning deoxygenated blood to the right atrium of the heart.")
(components vena_cava "[\"Superior vena cava\",\"Inferior vena cava\"]")
(diameter vena_cava "2-3 cm")
(function vena_cava "Return of deoxygenated blood to the heart")

(instance spinal_cord Nerve)
(name spinal_cord "Spinal Cord")
(description spinal_cord "The cylindrical bundle of nerve fibers that extends from the brain and is protected by the vertebral column.")
(length spinal_cord "45 cm (average adult)")
(location spinal_cord "Within the vertebral canal")
(function spinal_cord "Conduction of neural signals between brain and body, reflex center")
(components spinal_cord "[\"Grey matter\",\"White matter\",\"Central canal\"]")

(instance vagus_nerve Nerve)
(name vagus_nerve "Vagus Nerve")
(description vagus_nerve "The 10th cranial nerve, with the widest distribution in the body, controlling parasympathetic functions.")
(number vagus_nerve "CN X")
(function vagus_nerve "Parasympathetic control of heart, lungs, digestive tract; sensory information from viscera")
(length vagus_nerve "Extends from brainstem to abdomen")

(instance sciatic_nerve Nerve)
(name sciatic_nerve "Sciatic Nerve")
(description sciatic_nerve "The largest and longest nerve in the body, running from the lower back down through the leg.")
(origin sciatic_nerve "L4-S3 spinal nerves")
(function sciatic_nerve "Motor and sensory innervation of lower limb")
(diameter sciatic_nerve "About 2 cm at its widest")

(instance hypothalamus Nerve_center)
(name hypothalamus "Hypothalamus")
(description hypothalamus "A small region of the brain that coordinates both the autonomic nervous system and the endocrine system.")
(location hypothalamus "Below thalamus, above brainstem")
(weight hypothalamus "About 4 grams")
(functions hypothalamus "[\"Temperature regulation\",\"Hunger and thirst control\",\"Sleep-wake cycles\",\"Hormone production\",\"Autonomic function regulation\"]")

(instance neuron Cell)
(name neuron "Neuron")
(description neuron "The basic functional unit of the nervous system, specialized for transmitting information.")
(components neuron "[\"Cell body\",\"Dendrites\",\"Axon\",\"Synaptic terminals\"]")
(types neuron "[\"Motor neurons\",\"Sensory neurons\",\"Interneurons\"]")
(function neuron "Signal transmission and processing")
(count neuron "Approximately 86 billion in the human brain")

(instance red_blood_cell Cell)
(name red_blood_cell "Red Blood Cell (Erythrocyte)")
(description red_blood_cell "The most common type of blood cell, responsible for oxygen transport.")
(shape red_blood_cell "Biconcave disc")
(diameter red_blood_cell "7-8 micrometers")
(lifespan red_blood_cell "120 days")
(count red_blood_cell "4.5-5.5 million per microliter of blood")
(uniqueProperty red_blood_cell "No nucleus in mature form")
(function red_blood_cell "Oxygen and carbon dioxide transport")

(instance cardiomyocyte Cell)
(name cardiomyocyte "Cardiomyocyte")
(description cardiomyocyte "Cardiac muscle cells that make up the heart muscle.")
(length cardiomyocyte "100 micrometers")
(width cardiomyocyte "10-25 micrometers")
(properties cardiomyocyte "[\"Striated\",\"Contains many mitochondria\",\"Connected by intercalated discs\"]")
(function cardiomyocyte "Heart contraction")
(uniqueProperty cardiomyocyte "Can contract without neural stimulation")

(instance epithelial_tissue Tissue)
(name epithelial_tissue "Epithelial Tissue")
(description epithelial_tissue "The tissue that forms the outer layer of the body and lines organs and cavities.")
(types epithelial_tissue "[\"Simple squamous\",\"Simple cuboidal\",\"Simple columnar\",\"Stratified squamous\",\"Transitional\"]")
(functions epithelial_tissue "[\"Protection\",\"Absorption\",\"Filtration\",\"Secretion\"]")
(location epithelial_tissue "Skin surface, organ linings, gland secretory units")

(attaches_to muscular_system skeletal_system)

(part_of brain nervous_system)
(description-part_of brain nervous_system "The brain is the central organ of the nervous system")

(part_of skull skeletal_system)
(description-part_of skull skeletal_system "The skull is part of the axial skeleton")

(part_of liver digestive_system)
(description-part_of liver digestive_system "The liver produces bile for digestion and processes nutrients")

(interacts_with kidneys circulatory_system)
(description-interacts_with kidneys circulatory_system "The kidneys filter blood to maintain homeostasis")

(protects skull brain)
(description-protects skull brain "The skull forms a protective case around the brain")

(protects ribcage heart)
(description-protects ribcage heart "The ribcage forms a protective structure around the heart")

(protects ribcage lungs)
(description-protects ribcage lungs "The ribcage forms a protective structure around the lungs")

(protects vertebral_column spinal_cord)
(description-protects vertebral_column spinal_cord "The vertebral column forms a protective tunnel for the spinal cord")

(connects_to heart aorta)
(description-connects_to heart aorta "The aorta emerges from the left ventricle of the heart")

(connects_to heart vena_cava)
(description-connects_to heart vena_cava "The vena cava returns blood to the right atrium of the heart")

(supplies coronary_arteries heart)

(connects_to pulmonary_arteries lungs)
(description-connects_to pulmonary_arteries lungs "The pulmonary arteries carry deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs")

(connects_to brain spinal_cord)
(description-connects_to brain spinal_cord "The brain connects to the spinal cord at the brainstem")

(innervates vagus_nerve heart)
(description-innervates vagus_nerve heart "The vagus nerve provides parasympathetic innervation to the heart")

(innervates vagus_nerve stomach)
(description-innervates vagus_nerve stomach "The vagus nerve provides parasympathetic innervation to the stomach")

(regulates hypothalamus endocrine_system)

(composes heart_muscle heart)

(enables diaphragm respiratory_system)

(moves biceps_brachii femur)

(composes cardiomyocyte heart_muscle)

(lines epithelial_tissue lungs)
(description-lines epithelial_tissue lungs "Epithelial tissue lines the airways of the lungs")
